thread.title: Crescent City Farmers Market throws a moonlit bash
thread.title_full: Crescent City Farmers Market throws a moonlit bash | NOLA.com

author: Todd A. Price, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Crescent City Farmers Market throws a moonlit bash
text:
For two decades, farmers, small producers and discerning shoppers have met each Saturday mornings at the Warehouse District's Crescent City Farmers Market . On Saturday (Oct. 10), the market invites its supporters to come downtown at night for the second annual Moonlight Market fundraiser.
At the party, 20 bars and restaurants, including Clancy's, Boucherie and La Petite Grocery, will be serving food and "garden-to-glass" cocktails. Local beers will be poured. A silent auction will be held. And King James & the Special Men will entertain the crowds.
This year, the Moonlight Market honors W. Boatner Reily III, who in 1995 let the original market organizers to use the Reily Foods Company's parking lot at the corner of Magazine and Girod streets.
The Crescent City Farmers Market now runs four markets: Saturday in the Warehouse District, Tuesday in Uptown, Wednesday in the French Quarter and Thursday in Mid-City. The market supports more than 75 vendors.
Tickets to the Moonlight Market, which includes all food and drinks, are $45 through Oct. 8 at 7 p.m. and $60 afterward. Tickets can be purchased at any Crescent Farmers Market, online at CrescentCityFarmersMarket.org or at the event.
Moonlight Market kicks off at 7 p.m. and will be held at 725 Magazine St.
